Enum Difficulty

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Difficulty>
      • Difficulty
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Difficulty>

    public enum Difficulty
extends java.lang.Enum<Difficulty>
    WereWolfenstein 2D: possible difficulty settings. To declare a variable of this type, do so the same way as for other classes: 
    Difficulty difficulty;
    To refer to a value of this enumerated type (such as EASY), write: 
    Difficulty.EASY
    as in this assignment statement 
    difficulty = Difficulty.EASY;
    And, importantly, to convert a String into a value of this type, use the following, which assumes that the String input contains some variant of "easy", "normal" or "hard"): 
    difficulty = Difficulty.valueOf( input.toUpperCase() );
    To display details of a Difficulty level, such as difficulty above, just use it as part of a String, as in: 
    String diffMsg = "Settings: " + difficulty;
    You will never use the new keyword with this type.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getPlayerStartsInVillage()
      Returns true if the player starts in the same area as the village for this difficulty level, false otherwise.
      int getSilverBulletCount()
      Returns the number of silver bullets the player starts with in this difficulty level.
      int getVillagerCount()
      Returns the initial number of villagers for this difficulty level.
      boolean getWolfMovesWhenShot()
      Returns true if the werewolf moves when hit, false otherwise.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a multi-line String describing the characteristics of this difficulty level.

      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
